content.p: The Nottingham Centre for Evidence-Based Healthcare (CEBHC) is part of the University of Nottingham’s Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences. We are a vibrant, growing centre made up of experienced academic researchers, information scientists and clinical practitioners, all specialising in evidence synthesis. Together, we publish systematic reviews using a variety of methodologies, registered through JBI and Cochrane Collaboration, with the aim of improving healthcare practices for the benefit of patients and practitioners all over the world. Our centre has three main areas of activity: To find out more about how our work makes an impact, explore the centre’s systematic reviews, collaborative projects, and training opportunities. Follow us: @UoNCEBHC Our team of experts includes academic researchers, information scientists and clinical practitioners... Our projects focus on delivering systematic reviews for a broad range of healthcare challenges.... We offer a range of JBI Comprehensive Systematic Review Training Programmes (CSRTP)... The Centre for Evidence Based Healthcare is an officially designated Centre of Excellence within the JBI network...
